s0011.chinese: 然王跡之興，起於閭巷，合從討伐，軼於三代，鄉秦之禁，適足以資賢者為驅除難耳。

s0012.chinese: 故憤發其所為天下雄，安在無土不王。

s0015.chinese: 非大聖孰能當此受命而帝者乎？

s47.chinese: 二。葛嬰為涉徇九江，立襄彊為楚王。
s47.literal: Two. Ge Ying for She toured Jiujiang, established Xiang Qiang as Chu king.
s47.idiomatic: Second day. Ge Ying toured Jiujiang for She, established Xiang Qiang as Chu king.

s49.chinese: 武臣始至邯鄲，自立為趙王，始。
s49.literal: Wu Chen first arrived Handan, self-established as Zhao king, beginning.
s49.idiomatic: Wu Chen first arrived at Handan, self-established as Zhao king - beginning.

s56.literal: Ninth month. Chu troops arrived Xi.
s56.idiomatic: Ninth month. Chu troops arrived at Xi.

s57.chinese: 三。周文兵至戲，敗。而葛嬰聞涉王，即殺彊。
s57.literal: Three. Zhou Wen troops arrived Xi, defeated. Yet Ge Ying heard She king, immediately killed Qiang.
s57.idiomatic: Third day. Zhou Wen's troops arrived at Xi and were defeated. Yet Ge Ying heard of She as king and immediately killed Qiang.

s58.literal: Xiang Liang styled Martial Faith Lord.
s58.idiomatic: Xiang Liang styled himself Martial Faith Lord.

s60.chinese: 齊王田儋始。儋，狄人。諸田宗彊。從弟榮，榮弟橫。
s60.literal: Qi king Tian Dan beginning. Dan, Di person. Various Tian clan strong. Younger brother Rong, Rong younger brother Heng.
s60.idiomatic: Qi king Tian Dan beginning. Dan was a Di person. The various Tian clan were strong. Younger brother Rong, Rong's younger brother Heng.

s62.chinese: 韓廣為趙略地至薊，自立為燕王始。
s62.literal: Han Guang for Zhao seized territory to Ji, self-established as Yan king beginning.
s62.idiomatic: Han Guang seized territory for Zhao up to Ji, self-established as Yan king - beginning.

s63.chinese: 魏王咎始。咎在陳，不得歸國。
s63.literal: Wei king Jiu beginning. Jiu at Chen, unable return state.
s63.idiomatic: Wei king Jiu beginning. Jiu was at Chen, unable to return to his state.

s70.literal: Two. Dan what rose, killed Di magistrate self king.
s70.idiomatic: Second day. When Dan rose, he killed the Di magistrate and made himself king.

s71.chinese: 二。擊胡陵、方與，破秦監軍。
s71.literal: Two. Attacked Hu Ling, Fang Yu, broke Qin supervising army.
s71.idiomatic: Second day. Attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, defeated the Qin supervising army.

s79.chinese: 四。李良殺武臣，張耳、陳餘走。
s79.literal: Four. Li Liang killed Wu Chen, Zhang Er, Chen Yu fled.
s79.idiomatic: Fourth day. Li Liang killed Wu Chen, Zhang Er and Chen Yu fled.

s81.chinese: 三。殺泗水守。拔薛西。周市東略地豐沛閒。
s81.literal: Three. Killed Si Shui guard. Pulled Xue west. Zhou Shi east seized territory Feng Pei between.
s81.idiomatic: Third day. Killed the Si Shui guard. Pulled Xue west. Zhou Shi east seized territory between Feng and Pei.

s83.chinese: 三。齊、趙共立周市，市不肯，曰「必立魏咎」云。
s83.literal: Three. Qi, Zhao together established Zhou Shi, Shi not willing, said 'must establish Wei Jiu' thus.
s83.idiomatic: Third day. Qi and Zhao together established Zhou Shi, but Shi was not willing, saying 'must establish Wei Jiu'.

s91.chinese: 四。雍齒叛沛公，以豐降魏。沛公還攻豐，不能下。
s91.literal: Four. Yong Chi rebelled Pei duke, with Feng surrendered Wei. Pei duke returned attacked Feng, could not take.
s91.idiomatic: Fourth day. Yong Chi rebelled against Pei duke, surrendered Feng to Wei. Pei duke returned and attacked Feng, but could not take it.

s93.literal: Four. Jiu from Chen returned, established.
s93.idiomatic: Fourth day. Jiu returned from Chen and was established.

s97.literal: Chu king Jing Ju beginning, Qin Jia established him.
s97.idiomatic: Chu king Jing Ju beginning, Qin Jia established him.

s98.chinese: 五。涉將召平矯拜項梁為楚柱國，急西擊秦。
s98.literal: Five. She general Zhao Ping falsely appointed Xiang Liang as Chu pillar state, urgently west attacked Qin.
s98.idiomatic: Fifth day. She general Zhao Ping falsely appointed Xiang Liang as Chu pillar state, urgently attacked Qin to the west.

s99.chinese: 趙王歇始，張耳、陳餘立之。
s99.literal: Zhao king Xie beginning, Zhang Er, Chen Yu established him.
s99.idiomatic: Zhao king Xie beginning, Zhang Er and Chen Yu established him.

s100.chinese: 五。讓景駒以擅自王不請我。
s100.literal: Five. Reprimanded Jing Ju for arbitrarily becoming king without consulting me.
s100.idiomatic: Fifth day. Reprimanded Jing Ju for arbitrarily becoming king without consulting me.

s101.chinese: 五。沛公聞景駒王在留，往從，與擊秦軍碭西。
s101.literal: Five. Pei duke heard Jing Ju king at Liu, went followed, together attacked Qin army Dang west.
s101.idiomatic: Fifth day. Pei duke heard Jing Ju was king at Liu, went to follow him, and together attacked Qin army west of Dang.

s103.chinese: 五。章邯已破涉，圍咎臨濟。
s103.literal: Five. Zhang Han already defeated She, surrounded Jiu at Linji.
s103.idiomatic: Fifth day. Zhang Han had already defeated She, surrounded Jiu at Linji.

s107.idiomatic: Second day. Jia became supreme general.

s108.chinese: 六。梁渡江，陳嬰、黥布皆屬。
s108.literal: Six. Liang crossed Jiang, Chen Ying, Qing Bu all attached.
s108.idiomatic: Sixth day. Liang crossed the Jiang, Chen Ying and Qing Bu all attached.

s110.chinese: 六。景駒使公孫慶讓齊，誅慶。
s110.literal: Six. Jing Ju sent Gongsun Qing to reprimand Qi, executed Qing.
s110.idiomatic: Sixth day. Jing Ju sent Gongsun Qing to reprimand Qi, executed Qing.

s111.chinese: 六。攻下碭，收得兵六千，與故凡九千人。
s111.literal: Six. Attacked and took Dang, gathered six thousand troops, with former altogether nine thousand.
s111.idiomatic: Sixth day. Attacked and took Dang, gathered six thousand troops, with the former altogether nine thousand.

s121.chinese: 七。攻拔下邑，遂擊豐，豐不拔。聞項梁兵眾，往請擊豐。
s121.literal: Seven. Attacked and pulled Xiayi, then attacked Feng, Feng not taken. Heard Xiang Liang troops numerous, went requested attack Feng.
s121.idiomatic: Seventh day. Attacked and pulled Xiayi, then attacked Feng, Feng not taken. Heard Xiang Liang had numerous troops, went and requested to attack Feng.

s128.chinese: 八。梁擊殺景駒、秦嘉，遂入薛，兵十餘萬眾。
s128.literal: Eight. Liang attacked and killed Jing Ju, Qin Jia, then entered Xue, troops ten more myriad multitude.
s128.idiomatic: Eighth day. Liang attacked and killed Jing Ju and Qin Jia, then entered Xue, troops more than one hundred thousand in multitude.

s131.chinese: 八。沛公如薛見項梁，梁益沛公卒五千，擊豐，拔之。雍齒奔魏。
s131.literal: Eight. Pei duke went to Xue to see Xiang Liang, Liang increased Pei duke troops five thousand, attacked Feng, took it. Yong Chi fled to Wei.
s131.idiomatic: Eighth day. Pei duke went to Xue to see Xiang Liang, Liang increased Pei duke's troops by five thousand, attacked Feng, took it. Yong Chi fled to Wei.

s133.chinese: 八。臨濟急，周市如齊、楚請救。
s133.literal: Eight. Linji urgent, Zhou Shi went to Qi, Chu requested rescue.
s133.idiomatic: Eighth day. Linji was urgent, Zhou Shi went to Qi and Chu to request rescue.

s147.chinese: 楚懷王始，都盱台，故懷王孫，梁立之。
s147.literal: Chu Huai king beginning, capital Xutai, former Huai king grandson, Liang established him.
s147.idiomatic: Chu King Huai beginning, capital at Xutai, the former King Huai's grandson, Liang established him.

s148.chinese: 十。梁求楚懷王孫，得之民閒，立為楚王。
s148.literal: Ten. Liang sought Chu Huai king grandson, got him among the people, established as Chu king.
s148.idiomatic: Tenth day. Liang sought the Chu King Huai's grandson, got him from among the people, established him as Chu king.

s150.chinese: 十。儋救臨濟，章邯殺田儋。榮走東阿。
s150.literal: Ten. Dan rescued Linji, Zhang Han killed Tian Dan. Rong fled Dong'e.
s150.idiomatic: Tenth day. Dan rescued Linji, Zhang Han killed Tian Dan. Rong fled to Dong'e.

s151.chinese: 十。沛公如薛，共立楚懷王。
s151.literal: Ten. Pei duke went to Xue, together established Chu Huai king.
s151.idiomatic: Tenth day. Pei duke went to Xue, together established Chu King Huai.

s153.literal: Ten. Jiu committed suicide, Linji surrendered to Qin.
s153.idiomatic: Tenth day. Jiu committed suicide, Linji surrendered to Qin.

s157.literal: Two. Chen Ying became pillar state.
s157.idiomatic: Second day. Chen Ying became pillar state.

s158.chinese: 十一。天大雨，三月不見星。
s158.literal: Eleven. Heaven great rain, three months not see stars.
s158.idiomatic: Eleventh day. Heaven great rain, three months not see stars.

s160.chinese: 齊立田假為王，秦急圍東阿。
s160.literal: Qi established Tian Jia as king, Qin urgently surrounded Dong'e.
s160.idiomatic: Qi established Tian Jia as king, Qin urgently surrounded Dong'e.

s161.chinese: 十一。沛公與項羽北救東阿，破秦軍濮陽，東屠城陽。
s161.literal: Eleven. Pei duke with Xiang Yu north rescued Dong'e, broke Qin army Puyang, east slaughtered Chengyang.
s161.idiomatic: Eleventh day. Pei duke with Xiang Yu north rescued Dong'e, broke Qin army at Puyang, east slaughtered Chengyang.

s163.literal: Jiu younger brother Bao fled Dong'e.
s163.idiomatic: Jiu's younger brother Bao fled to Dong'e.

s168.chinese: 十二。救東阿，破秦軍，乘勝至定陶，項梁有驕色。
s168.literal: Twelve. Rescued Dong'e, broke Qin army, rode victory to Dingtao, Xiang Liang had arrogant color.
s168.idiomatic: Twelfth day. Rescued Dong'e, broke Qin army, rode victory to Dingtao, Xiang Liang had an arrogant appearance.

s170.chinese: 楚救榮，得解歸，逐田假，立儋子市為齊王，始。
s170.literal: Chu rescued Rong, got to return home, expelled Tian Jia, established Dan son Shi as Qi king, beginning.
s170.idiomatic: Chu rescued Rong, got to return home, expelled Tian Jia, established Dan's son Shi as Qi king, beginning.

s171.chinese: 十二。沛公與項羽西略地，斬三川守李由於雍丘。
s171.literal: Twelve. Pei duke with Xiang Yu west seized territory, beheaded Sanchuan guard Li You at Yongqiu.
s171.idiomatic: Twelfth day. Pei duke with Xiang Yu west seized territory, beheaded the Sanchuan guard Li You at Yongqiu.

s177.idiomatic: Fourth day. Moved capital to Pengcheng.

s178.chinese: 十三。章邯破殺項梁於定陶，項羽恐，還軍彭城。
s178.literal: Thirteen. Zhang Han defeated and killed Xiang Liang at Dingtao, Xiang Yu feared, returned army Pengcheng.
s178.idiomatic: Thirteenth day. Zhang Han defeated and killed Xiang Liang at Dingtao, Xiang Yu feared, returned the army to Pengcheng.

s180.chinese: 二。田假走楚，楚趨齊救趙。田榮以假故，不肯，謂「楚殺假乃出兵。」項羽怒田榮。
s180.literal: Two. Tian Jia fled Chu, Chu hastened Qi to save Zhao. Tian Rong because of Jia reason, not willing, said 'Chu kill Jia then send troops.' Xiang Yu angry at Tian Rong.
s180.idiomatic: Second day. Tian Jia fled to Chu, Chu hastened to Qi to save Zhao. Tian Rong because of Jia, was not willing, said 'Chu kill Jia then send troops.' Xiang Yu was angry at Tian Rong.

s181.chinese: 十三。沛公聞項梁死，還軍，從懷王，軍於碭。
s181.literal: Thirteen. Pei duke heard Xiang Liang died, returned army, followed Huai king, camped at Dang.
s181.idiomatic: Thirteenth day. Pei duke heard Xiang Liang died, returned the army, followed King Huai, camped at Dang.

s183.chinese: 魏豹自立為魏王，都平陽，始。
s183.literal: Wei Bao self-established as Wei king, capital Pingyang, beginning.
s183.idiomatic: Wei Bao self-established as Wei king, capital at Pingyang, beginning.

s187.literal: Five. Appointed Song Yi as supreme general.
s187.idiomatic: Fifth day. Appointed Song Yi as supreme general.

s188.chinese: 懷王封項羽於魯，為次將，屬宋義，北救趙。
s188.literal: Huai king enfeoffed Xiang Yu at Lu, made deputy general, belonged to Song Yi, north rescued Zhao.
s188.idiomatic: King Huai enfeoffed Xiang Yu at Lu, made him deputy general, belonging to Song Yi, north to rescue Zhao.

s189.chinese: 十。秦軍圍歇鉅鹿，陳餘出收兵。
s189.literal: Ten. Qin army surrounded Xie Julu, Chen Yu went out gathered troops.
s189.idiomatic: Tenth day. Qin army surrounded Xie at Julu, Chen Yu went out and gathered troops.

s191.chinese: 十四。懷王封沛公為武安侯，將碭郡兵西，約先至咸陽王之。
s191.literal: Fourteen. Huai king enfeoffed Pei duke as Wuan marquis, led Dang commandery troops west, agreed first arrive Xianyang king it.
s191.idiomatic: Fourteenth day. King Huai enfeoffed Pei duke as Marquis of Wuan, led Dang commandery troops west, agreed whoever first arrived at Xianyang would be king there.

s199.chinese: 十一。章邯破邯鄲，徙其民於河內。
s199.literal: Eleven. Zhang Han broke Handan, moved its people to Henei.
s199.idiomatic: Eleventh day. Zhang Han broke Handan, moved its people to Henei.

s200.chinese: 四。齊將田都叛榮，往助項羽救趙。
s200.literal: Four. Qi general Tian Du rebelled against Rong, went to assist Xiang Yu rescue Zhao.
s200.idiomatic: Fourth day. Qi general Tian Du rebelled against Rong, went to assist Xiang Yu in rescuing Zhao.

s201.chinese: 十五。攻破東郡尉及王離軍於成武南。
s201.literal: Fifteen. Attacked and broke Dongjun wei and Wang Li army at Chengwu south.
s201.idiomatic: Fifteenth day. Attacked and broke the Dongjun wei and Wang Li's army south of Chengwu.

s202.literal: Fifteen. Sent general Zang Tu rescue Zhao.
s202.idiomatic: Fifteenth day. Sent general Zang Tu to rescue Zhao.

s207.idiomatic: Seventh day. Appointed Ji as supreme general.

s208.chinese: 三。羽矯殺宋義，將其兵渡河救鉅鹿。
s208.literal: Three. Yu falsely killed Song Yi, led his troops crossed river rescued Julu.
s208.idiomatic: Third day. Yu falsely killed Song Yi, led his troops across the river to rescue Julu.

s218.chinese: 四。大破秦軍鉅鹿下，諸侯將皆屬項羽。
s218.literal: Four. Greatly broke Qin army below Julu, feudal lords generals all belonged to Xiang Yu.
s218.idiomatic: Fourth day. Greatly broke the Qin army below Julu, all feudal lords' generals belonged to Xiang Yu.

s219.literal: Thirteen. Chu rescue arrived, Qin siege lifted.
s219.idiomatic: Thirteenth day. Chu rescue arrived, Qin siege was lifted.

s220.chinese: 六。故齊王建孫田安下濟北，從項羽救趙。
s220.literal: Six. Former Qi king Jian grandson Tian An took Jibei, followed Xiang Yu rescued Zhao.
s220.idiomatic: Sixth day. Former Qi king Jian's grandson Tian An took Jibei, followed Xiang Yu to rescue Zhao.

s221.chinese: 十七。（救趙）至栗，得皇訢、武蒲軍。與秦軍戰，破之。
s221.literal: Seventeen. (Rescue Zhao) arrived Li, got Huang Xin, Wu Pu army. Battled with Qin army, broke it.
s221.idiomatic: Seventeenth day. (Rescue Zhao) arrived at Li, got the Huang Xin and Wu Pu army. Battled with Qin army, broke it.

s228.literal: Five. Captured Qin general Wang Li.
s228.idiomatic: Fifth day. Captured Qin general Wang Li.

s229.chinese: 十四。張耳怒陳餘，棄將印去。
s229.literal: Fourteen. Zhang Er angry at Chen Yu, abandoned general seal left.
s229.idiomatic: Fourteenth day. Zhang Er angry at Chen Yu, abandoned the general seal and left.

s238.literal: Six. Attacked and broke Zhang Han, Zhang Han army retreated.
s238.idiomatic: Sixth day. Attacked and broke Zhang Han, Zhang Han's army retreated.

s241.chinese: 十九。得彭越軍昌邑，襲陳留。用酈食其策，軍得積粟。
s241.literal: Nineteen. Got Peng Yue army Changyi, raided Chenliu. Used Li Yiji strategy, army got stored grain.
s241.idiomatic: Nineteenth day. Got Peng Yue's army at Changyi, raided Chenliu. Used Li Yiji's strategy, army got stored grain.

s251.chinese: 二十。攻開封，破秦將楊熊，熊走滎陽，秦斬熊以徇。
s251.literal: Twenty. Attacked Kaifeng, broke Qin general Yang Xiong, Xiong fled Xiangyang, Qin beheaded Xiong to display.
s251.idiomatic: Twentieth day. Attacked Kaifeng, broke Qin general Yang Xiong. Xiong fled to Xiangyang, Qin beheaded Xiong to display.

s258.chinese: 八。楚急攻章邯，章邯恐，使長史欣歸秦請兵，趙高讓之。
s258.literal: Eight. Chu urgently attacked Zhang Han, Zhang Han feared, sent chief clerk Xin return Qin request troops, Zhao Gao refused him.
s258.idiomatic: Eighth day. Chu urgently attacked Zhang Han. Zhang Han feared and sent chief clerk Xin to return to Qin to request troops, but Zhao Gao refused him.

s261.chinese: 二十一。攻潁陽，略韓地，北絕河津。
s261.literal: Twenty-one. Attacked Yingyang, raided Han lands, north cut off river crossings.
s261.idiomatic: Twenty-first day. Attacked Yingyang, raided Han lands, cut off river crossings to the north.

s268.chinese: 九。趙高欲誅欣，欣恐，亡走，告章邯謀叛秦。
s268.literal: Nine. Zhao Gao desired execute Xin, Xin feared, fled ran away, told Zhang Han plotting rebel Qin.
s268.idiomatic: Ninth day. Zhao Gao desired to execute Xin. Xin feared, fled, and told Zhang Han that he was plotting to rebel against Qin.

s278.chinese: 十。章邯與楚約降，未定，項羽許而擊之。
s278.literal: Ten. Zhang Han with Chu agreed surrender, not yet decided, Xiang Yu agreed then attacked him.
s278.idiomatic: Tenth day. Zhang Han agreed to surrender to Chu, but before it was finalized, Xiang Yu agreed then attacked him.

s281.chinese: 二十三。攻南陽守齮，破之陽城郭東。
s281.literal: Twenty-three. Attacked Nanyang defender Yi, broke him east of Yangcheng walls.
s281.idiomatic: Twenty-third day. Attacked Nanyang defender Yi, broke him east of Yangcheng's walls.

s288.chinese: 十一。項羽與章邯期殷虛，章邯等已降，與盟，以邯為雍王。
s288.literal: Eleven. Xiang Yu with Zhang Han agreed Yin Xu, Zhang Han etc already surrendered, made alliance with him, made Han Yong king.
s288.idiomatic: Eleventh day. Xiang Yu agreed with Zhang Han to meet at Yin Xu. Zhang Han and others had already surrendered, made an alliance with them, and made Han the Yong king.

s291.chinese: 二十四。降下南陽，封其守齮。
s291.literal: Twenty-four. Surrender took Nanyang, sealed its defender Yi.
s291.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth day. Surrender took Nanyang, sealed its defender Yi.

s294.literal: Fifteen. Shen Yang took Henan, surrendered to Chu.
s294.idiomatic: Fifteenth day. Shen Yang took Henan, surrendered to Chu.

s296.literal: Eighth month. Zhao Gao killed Second Emperor.
s296.idiomatic: Eighth month. Zhao Gao killed the Second Emperor.

s298.chinese: 十二。以秦降都尉翳、長史欣為上將，將秦降軍。
s298.literal: Twelve. Made Qin surrender major Yi, chief clerk Xin supreme generals, led Qin surrender army.
s298.idiomatic: Twelfth day. Made Qin surrender major Yi and chief clerk Xin supreme generals, led the Qin surrender army.

s299.chinese: 二十一。趙王歇留國。陳餘亡居南皮。
s299.literal: Twenty-one. Zhao king Xie stayed in state. Chen Yu fled resided Nanpi.
s299.idiomatic: Twenty-first day. Zhao king Xie stayed in the state. Chen Yu fled and resided in Nanpi.

s301.idiomatic: Twenty-fifth day. Attacked Wuguan, broke it.

s311.chinese: 二十六。攻下嶢及藍田。以留侯策，不戰皆降。
s311.literal: Twenty-six. Attacked took Yao and Lantian. With Liu Hou strategy, without battle all surrendered.
s311.idiomatic: Twenty-sixth day. Attacked and took Yao and Lantian. With Liu Hou's strategy, without battle all surrendered.

s318.chinese: 十四。項羽將諸侯兵四十餘萬，行略地，西至於河南。
s318.literal: Fourteen. Xiang Yu led feudal lords troops forty more ten thousand, went raided lands, west reached Henan.
s318.idiomatic: Fourteenth day. Xiang Yu led the feudal lords' troops, more than 400,000, went raiding lands, reached west to Henan.

s319.chinese: 二十三。張耳從楚西入秦。
s319.literal: Twenty-three. Zhang Er followed Chu west entered Qin.
s319.idiomatic: Twenty-third day. Zhang Er followed Chu and entered Qin to the west.

s321.chinese: 二十七。漢元年，秦王子嬰降。沛公入破咸陽，平秦，還軍霸上，待諸侯約。
s321.literal: Twenty-seven. Han first year, Qin prince Ziying surrendered. Pei Gong entered broke Xianyang, pacified Qin, returned army Baxiang, awaited feudal lords agreement.
s321.idiomatic: Twenty-seventh day. Han first year. Qin prince Ziying surrendered. Pei Gong entered and broke Xianyang, pacified Qin, returned the army to Baxiang, awaited the feudal lords' agreement.

s323.chinese: 十五。從項羽略地，遂入關
s323.literal: Fifteen. Followed Xiang Yu raided lands, then entered Guan.
s323.idiomatic: Fifteenth day. Followed Xiang Yu raiding lands, then entered the pass.

s328.chinese: 十五。羽詐阬殺秦降卒二十萬人於新安。
s328.literal: Fifteen. Yu fraudulently pit killed Qin surrender soldiers two hundred thousand people at Xin'an.
s328.idiomatic: Fifteenth day. Yu fraudulently pit-killed 200,000 Qin surrender soldiers at Xin'an.

s331.chinese: 二十八。沛公出令三章，秦民大悅。
s331.literal: Twenty-eight. Pei Gong issued three chapter proclamation, Qin people greatly pleased.
s331.idiomatic: Twenty-eighth day. Pei Gong issued the Three Chapters proclamation, the Qin people were greatly pleased.

s337.idiomatic: Eighth day. Divided Chu into four parts.

s338.chinese: 十六。至關中，誅秦王子嬰，屠燒咸陽。分天下，立諸侯。
s338.literal: Sixteen. Arrived Guan Zhong, executed Qin prince Ziying, massacred burned Xianyang. Divided the world, established feudal lords.
s338.idiomatic: Sixteenth day. Arrived in Guanzhong, executed Qin prince Ziying, massacred and burned Xianyang. Divided the world, established the feudal lords.

s339.literal: Twenty-five. Divided Zhao into Dai state.
s339.idiomatic: Twenty-fifth day. Divided Zhao into the Dai state.

s340.chinese: 十八。項羽怨榮，分齊為三國。
s340.literal: Eighteen. Xiang Yu resented Rong, divided Qi into three states.
s340.idiomatic: Eighteenth day. Xiang Yu resented Rong, divided Qi into three states.

s341.chinese: 二十九。與項羽有纳，見之戲下，講解。羽倍約，分關中為四國。
s341.literal: Twenty-nine. Had grievance with Xiang Yu, met him below Xi, made peace. Yu broke agreement, divided Guanzhong into four states.
s341.idiomatic: Twenty-ninth day. Had a grievance with Xiang Yu, met him below Xi, made peace. Yu broke the agreement, divided Guanzhong into four states.

s342.chinese: 二十九。臧荼從入，分燕為二國。
s342.literal: Twenty-nine. Zang Tu followed entered, divided Yan into two states.
s342.idiomatic: Twenty-ninth day. Zang Tu followed and entered, divided Yan into two states.

s343.literal: Seventeen. Divided Wei into Yin state.
s343.idiomatic: Seventeenth day. Divided Wei into the Yin state.

s344.literal: Twenty. Divided Han into Henan state.
s344.idiomatic: Twentieth day. Divided Han into the Henan state.

s367.chinese: 九。義帝元年。諸侯尊懷王為義帝。
s367.literal: Nine. Righteous Emperor first year. Feudal lords honored Huai Wang as Righteous Emperor.
s367.idiomatic: Ninth day. First year of the Righteous Emperor. The feudal lords honored Huai Wang as the Righteous Emperor.

s368.chinese: 十七。項籍自立為西楚霸王。
s368.literal: Seventeen. Xiang Ji self-established as Western Chu Hegemon King.
s368.idiomatic: Seventeenth day. Xiang Ji self-established as the Western Chu Hegemon King.

s372.idiomatic: Twenty-sixth day. Changed name to Changshan.

s374.idiomatic: Nineteenth day. Changed name to Linzi.

s377.literal: First month. Divided Guanzhong into Han.
s377.idiomatic: First month. Divided Guanzhong into Han.

s383.idiomatic: Eighteenth day. Changed to Western Wei.

s388.literal: Two. Moved capital to southern Jiangnan Chen.
s388.idiomatic: Second day. Moved capital to Chen in southern Jiangnan.

s389.chinese: 西楚主伯，項籍始，為天下主命，主十八王。
s389.literal: Western Chu hegemon uncle, Xiang Ji beginning, for world main fate, main eighteen kings.
s389.idiomatic: Western Chu hegemon uncle. Xiang Ji's beginning. Commands the world's fate, controls eighteen kings.

s390.literal: King Wu Rui beginning, former Fan lord.
s390.idiomatic: King Wu Rui's beginning. Former Fan lord.

s391.literal: King Gong Ao beginning, former Chu pillar state.
s391.idiomatic: King Gong Ao's beginning. Former Chu pillar state.

s392.literal: King Ying Bu beginning, former Chu general.
s392.idiomatic: King Ying Bu's beginning. Former Chu general.

s393.literal: King Zhang Er beginning, former Chu general.
s393.idiomatic: King Zhang Er's beginning. Former Chu general.

s394.chinese: 二十七。。王趙歇始，故趙王。
s394.literal: Twenty-seven. King Zhao Xie beginning, former Zhao king.
s394.idiomatic: Twenty-seventh day. King Zhao Xie's beginning. Former Zhao king.

s395.literal: King Tian Du beginning, former Qi general.
s395.idiomatic: King Tian Du's beginning. Former Qi general.

s396.literal: King Tian An beginning, former Qi general.
s396.idiomatic: King Tian An's beginning. Former Qi general.

s397.literal: Twenty. King Tian Shi beginning, former Qi king.
s397.idiomatic: Twentieth day. King Tian Shi's beginning. Former Qi king.

s398.literal: Second month. Han king beginning, former Pei Gong.
s398.idiomatic: Second month. Han king's beginning. Former Pei Gong.

s399.literal: King Zhang Han beginning, former Qin general.
s399.idiomatic: King Zhang Han's beginning. Former Qin general.

s400.literal: King Sima Xin beginning, former Qin general.
s400.idiomatic: King Sima Xin's beginning. Former Qin general.

s401.literal: King Dong Yi beginning, former Qin general.
s401.idiomatic: King Dong Yi's beginning. Former Qin general.

s402.literal: King Zang Tu beginning, former Yan general.
s402.idiomatic: King Zang Tu's beginning. Former Yan general.

s403.chinese: 三十一。王韓廣始，故燕王。
s403.literal: Thirty-one. King Han Guang beginning, former Yan king.
s403.idiomatic: Thirty-first day. King Han Guang's beginning. Former Yan king.

s404.literal: Nineteen. King Wei Bao beginning, former Wei king.
s404.idiomatic: Nineteenth day. King Wei Bao's beginning. Former Wei king.

s405.literal: King Sima Ang beginning, former Zhao general.
s405.idiomatic: King Sima Ang's beginning. Former Zhao general.

s406.chinese: 二十二。王韓成始，故韓將。
s406.literal: Twenty-two. King Han Cheng beginning, former Han general.
s406.idiomatic: Twenty-second day. King Han Cheng's beginning. Former Han general.

s407.literal: King Shen Yang beginning, former Chu general.
s407.idiomatic: King Shen Yang's beginning. Former Chu general.

s431.chinese: 三。諸侯罷戲下兵，皆之國。
s431.literal: Three. Feudal lords dismissed Xi troops, all went to their states.
s431.idiomatic: Third day. Feudal lords dismissed the troops at Xi, all returned to their states.

s458.literal: Four. Tian Rong attacked Du, Du surrendered to Chu.
s458.idiomatic: Fourth day. Tian Rong attacked Du, Du surrendered to Chu.

s479.literal: Qi king Tian Rong beginning, former Qi chancellor.
s479.idiomatic: Qi king Tian Rong's beginning. Former Qi chancellor.

s481.literal: Twenty-four. Tian Rong attacked killed Shi.
s481.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth day. Tian Rong attacked and killed Shi.

s501.literal: Six. Tian Rong attacked killed An.
s501.idiomatic: Sixth day. Tian Rong attacked and killed An.

s511.idiomatic: Twenty-seventh day. Xiang Yu executed Cheng.

s525.literal: Seven. Han defended Feiqiu, Han surrounded him.
s525.idiomatic: Seventh day. Han defended Feiqiu, Han surrounded him.

s526.literal: Seven. Xin surrendered to Han, state eliminated.
s526.idiomatic: Seventh day. Xin surrendered to Han, state eliminated.

s527.literal: Seven. Yi surrendered to Han, state eliminated.
s527.idiomatic: Seventh day. Yi surrendered to Han, state eliminated.

s529.chinese: 三十七。臧荼擊廣無終，滅之。
s529.literal: Thirty-seven. Zang Tu attacked Guang Wuzhong, extinguished it.
s529.idiomatic: Thirty-seventh day. Zang Tu attacked Guang at Wuzhong, extinguished it.

s532.literal: Han king Zheng Chang beginning, Xiang Yu established him.
s532.idiomatic: Han king Zheng Chang's beginning. Xiang Yu established him.

s547.literal: Belonged to Han, became Weinan, Heshang commanderies.
s547.idiomatic: Belonged to Han, became Weinan and Heshang commanderies.

s548.literal: Belonged to Han as Shang commandery.
s548.idiomatic: Belonged to Han as Shang commandery.

s556.literal: Ten. Xiang Yu extinguished Righteous Emperor.
s556.idiomatic: Tenth day. Xiang Yu extinguished the Righteous Emperor.

s603.chinese: 歇以陳餘為代王，故成安君。

s626.chinese: 八。項籍擊榮，走平原平原民殺之。

s647.chinese: 項籍立故齊王田假為齊王。

s668.chinese: 二。田榮弟橫反城陽，擊假，走楚，楚殺假。

s683.chinese: 三。項羽以兵三萬破漢兵五十六萬。

s689.chinese: 齊王田廣始。廣，榮子，橫立之。

s692.chinese: 四月。王伐楚至彭城，壞走。

s734.chinese: 六月。王入關，立太子。復如滎陽。

s756.chinese: 屬漢，為隴西、北地、中地郡。

s875.chinese: 十二。布身降漢，地屬項籍。

s1103.chinese: 十一。漢將韓信破殺龍且。

s1109.chinese: 二十一。漢將韓信擊殺廣。

s1403.chinese: 十二。徙王楚，屬漢，為四郡。

s1406.chinese: 正月。。殺項籍，天下平，諸侯臣屬漢。

s1414.chinese: 四。韓王信徙王代，都馬邑。

s1427.chinese: 二月。甲午，王更號，即皇帝位於定陶。

s1436.chinese: 衡山王吳芮為為長沙王。

s1565.chinese: 九。王得故項羽將鍾離辚，斬之以聞。
